001package gust.backend.model;
002
003
004import com.google.protobuf.Message;
005
006import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
007import java.io.IOException;
008
009
010/**
011 * Describes the interface for a de-serializer, which is responsible for transitioning (adapting) objects from a given
012 * type (or tree of types) to {@link Message} instances, corresponding with the data record type managed by this object.
013 *
014 * <p>Deserializers are part of a wider set of objects, including the inverse of this object, which is called a
015 * {@link ModelSerializer}. Generally these objects come in matching pairs, but sometimes they are mixed and matched as
016 * needed. Pairs of serializers/de-serializers are grouped by a {@link ModelCodec}.</p>
017 *
018 * @see ModelSerializer The inverse of this object, which is responsible for adapting {@link Message} instances to some
019 *      other type of object or data.
020 * @param <Input> Input data type, which this de-serializer will convert into a message instance.
021 * @param <Model> Message object type, which is the output of this de-serializer.
022 */
023public interface ModelDeserializer<Input, Model extends Message> {
024  /**
025   * De-serialize a model instance from the provided input type, throwing exceptions verbosely if we are unable to
026   * correctly, verifiably, and properly load the record.
027   *
028   * @param input Input data or object from which to load the model instance.
029   * @return De-serialized and inflated model instance. Always a {@link Message}.
030   * @throws ModelInflateException If the model fails to load for any reason.
031   * @throws IOException If some IO error occurs.
032   */
033  @Nonnull Model inflate(@Nonnull Input input) throws ModelInflateException, IOException;
034}
